content.description:
Stand start with a left hand pocket and a right sidepull/jug. From there, stick a good right hand pocket, work the thin feet out left, gain a left hand and right hand edge (crux), work the feet under, then continue to a right hand sidepull, and eventual top out.

Staying low on the start is key to making the first move.
content.protection: A few pads should do it, the landing is good, but there are a few rocks to the left of the problem.
content.location:
This ascends the south face of Sol Tut, it climbs in between

Prostitute of Evolution

and

Sol Tut

.

content.description:
Sol Tut climbs an undercut face on mediocre rock over a great landing. Despite some questionable rock in areas, the movement is well worth a go.

Sit start with an inverted left hand undercling-pocket and a right hand edge-pinch above. From there, bump the right hand to an edge, follow to a left hand edge below it, gain a sidepull far out left, cut the feet loose and paste a high left foot, bump up through edges, achieve the feet on the face, finish up the jugs for an easy top out.
content.protection: A pair of pads should do it, the landing is very good for this problem.
content.location:
This ascends the south face of Sol Tut, it climbs in between

Vie King

and

Silent Shout

.

content.description:
Silent Shout is a complete compression/arete problem that ascends good rock over a good landing.

Sit start with hands matched on the arete. From there, pull up to a left hand edge, heel down, and crank up to the jug, then move out with the left hand to a big sidepull, bump the left up to a sharp edge (crux?), move the right hand up through a pair of bumps, eventually hit a horizontal left hand edge and a right hand two-finger pocket, get a right foot on the jug, rock around the arete to an edge, and top it out.
content.protection: Several pads, the immediate landing is clear, but there is tree directly behind the problem and a few rocks as well.
content.location: This ascends the southeast arete of Sol Tut.

content.description: Stand start with a pair of incut jugs about six feet off the deck. From there, gain a right hand edge, pull up to a left hand edge, bump the right hand up to another edge, work the feet up, use a left hand intermediate (crux) or go straight to the lip (crux), and top it out.
content.protection: Several pads, the landing has a pair of rocks that make for an uneven landing.
content.location:
It ascends the south face of Sol Tut, climbs in between

Fiddled Fingers

and

Vie King

.

content.description:
Fiddled Fingers is an arete climb that ascends a highly featured section of quality rock.

Sit start with a diagonal, left hand crimp and a pair of small bumps with the right hand.  From there, ascend the problem by slapping a left hand up the arete while working an assortment of holds with the right (crux section).  About halfway up, work through the crimps and pinch to gain a solid, jug-riddled topout.
content.protection: A few pads will do, but there are trees and rocks surrounding the landing.  Luckily, most of the rough spots on this problem are low, making it relatively safe.
content.location: This ascends the south side of the southwestern arete on Sol Tut.
